intro: Descurainia incana var. brevipes, commonly known as the short-stemmed hoary vetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are alternate, linear to lanceolate, and covered in fine, white hairs, which help reduce water loss. The species is adapted to survive in harsh conditions, making it a resilient component of its ecosystem.
